japanese:
二乃、しっかり捕まってろよ！
危ないからな！
translation:
Nino, hold on tight!
It's dangerous!

japanese:
わかってる！
平気よ、何度も乗せてもらってるもの。
translation:
I know! It's okay,
I've ridden many times with you before.

japanese:
けど、今日は走り慣れない道なんだ。
ついでにレンタルしたバイクで勝手も違うしな。
translation:
But today we're on an unfamiliar road.
Plus, we're riding a rental bike,
with different handling.

japanese:
ちょっと、怖くなるようなこと言わないでよ。
安全運転でお願いね。
translation:
Hey, come on, don't say things that'll scare me.
Please drive safely.

japanese:
任せとけ、白馬の王子様くらいの
丁寧さで運転してやる。
translation:
Don't worry, I'll drive as carefully as a white knight 
rides his steel horse.

japanese: ふふっ、なにそれ。
translation: Teehee, what's that supposed to mean?

japanese:
あー……。
自分でもなに言ってんだか、わからねぇ。
translation:
Ah...
The hell I'm sayin! I'm such a dork!

japanese:
変なこと言ってないで集中しなさい。
お姫様を振り落としたりしないでよね。
translation:
Don't say weird things,
focus on driving. Don't drop the princess, okay?

japanese: ……おう。
translation: Okay.

japanese: ……風太郎の匂いがする。
translation: ...I love your scent, Futaro.

japanese: えっ？　なんだ？
translation: Huh? What?

japanese: なんでもないわ。
translation: Nothing.

japanese:
（まさか、バイクで現れるなんて。
　予想外すぎよ）
translation:
(I never expected him to show up on a bike.
 It's too unexpected.)

japanese:
（沖縄の景色を見ながら、
　一緒に乗ってみたいとは思ってたけど……
　ここで叶うなんて思ってもみなかった）
translation:
(I've always wanted to ride with him
 and see the scenery of Okinawa...
 but I never thought it would happen here.)

japanese:
ねえ、風太郎？
どうして急にバイクなの？
translation: Hey, Futaro? Why did you suddenly bring a bike?

japanese:
お前、古宇利島（こうりじま）で
そんなこと言ってたよな。
本当はこうしたかったんだろ？
translation:
You said you wanted to take a ride on Kouri Island
before, right? You really wanted to do this, didn't you?

japanese: えっ……。
translation: Huh...?

japanese:
夕べ、バイクを借りられるところを調べてきたんだ。
あの時は気付けなくて悪かった。
translation:
Last night, I found a place where I could rent a bike.
Sorry I didn't realize it before.

japanese: 遅いわよ、もう。
translation: It's too late for apologizing now.

japanese:
でもいいわ。
ちゃんと気がついてくれたんだもの。
translation:
But it's okay.
At least you noticed the place.

japanese: じゃあ、これから古宇利島へ行くの？
translation: So, are we going to Kouri Island now?

japanese: いや、目的地は別になる。
translation: No, our destination is different.

japanese:
えー？　どこなの？
あの橋以上の景色なんてそうそうないでしょ？
translation:
Huh? Where are we going?
There's hardly any view better than that bridge, right?

japanese:
さあな、どうだろう？
だが、いまは俺の攻めのターンだ。
楽しみにしてくれていいぞ。
translation:
Who knows?
But now it's my turn to lead the way.
Better look forward to it.

japanese:
うん、わかった。
風太郎に全部任せるわ。
translation:
Okay, I understand.
I'll leave everything to you, Futaro.

japanese:
（……思い返してみると、
　風太郎とバイクに乗る時は
　いつも思いがけないことが起きるのよね）
translation:
(Come to think of it,
 whenever I ride a motorcycle with Futaro,
 something unexpected always happens.)

japanese:
（初めては、２年の頃、
　期末テストのあとに告白した時――）
translation:
(The first time was in our second year,
 after final exams, when I confessed my feelings
 to him.)

japanese:
（どうして突然言っちゃったのか、
　いまでもわからない。
　おまけに風太郎は聞き逃したなんて言うし）
translation:
(I still don't know why I said it all of a sudden,
 and on top of that,
 Futaro said he didn't hear it.)

japanese: 好きよ。
translation: I love you.

japanese:
ふふっ！
やっぱり、もうちょっと雰囲気は
欲しかったかしらね。
translation:
Hehe!
I guess I wanted a bit more of an atmosphere after all.

japanese: ん？　どうかしたか？
translation: Hm? What's wrong?

japanese: ううん、なんでもない。
translation: No, nothing.

japanese: （学園祭でキスした夜も……）
translation: (On the night we kissed at the school festival...)

japanese: （あの時、やっぱり恋は攻めてこそだと思った）
translation:
(I still believe
 that love is something you have to go after.)

japanese:
（押しても引いても手応えがなくても……
　更に攻めるのが私）
translation:
(Even if I don't get any response...
 I'll keep pushing forward.)

japanese:
（こうして風太郎と一緒にいられるのは、
　そんな私のやり方を貫いてきたから）
translation:
(I can only be together with Futaro like this because
 I've always done things my way.)

japanese:
（ねえ風太郎？
　あんたは私に、本当の恋を教えてくれたわ）
translation:
(Hey, Futaro?
 You're the one who taught me what true love is.)

japanese:
（そして私は、あんたに
　新しい世界を見せたって言ってたわよね）
translation: (And you said you'd show me a new world, didn't you?)

japanese:
（今日は、なにを教えてくれるの？
　私になにを見せてくれるの……？）
translation:
(So, what are you going to teach me today?
 What are you going to show me...?)
